channel.title: Pages on Brian Jay Tang
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Brian Jay Tang

item.title: About Me
item.description: Biosketch Iâ€™m a 1st year Computer Science PhD student at the University of Michigan and a member of the Real-Time Computing Lab (advised by Prof. Kang Shin ). Currently, my research focuses on the intersection between usable privacy and machine learning. As an undergraduate student, I was a part of the Wisconsin Privacy and Security Group working with Prof. Kassem Fawaz , Prof. Varun Chandrasekaran , and Prof. Somesh Jha on machine learning security and privacy.

item.title: Service
item.description: External/Sub Reviewer PoPETS | Spring 2021 USENIX Security | Spring 2020 Mentoring I hope to mentor some students to be great researchers soon! Volunteering Feed My Starving Children Westmont Public Library Burgess Square Healthcare & Rehab Centre Transcend UW Sakura-Con Other various small events and fundraisers

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I’d like to teach and TA with the extra time I’ll have after finishing my PhD course requirements. Along with teaching at the University of Michigan, I’d like to volunteer and teach Computer Science at K-12 schools.
